titulo: Python: The Origin of the Name
texto:
Contrary to popular belief, the name of the Python programming language has nothing to do with the python snake. The real story behind the name is much more fun and involves a British comedy television show.

 In 1989, Guido van Rossum, the creator of Python, was working at the Centrum Wiskunde & Informatica (CWI) in the Netherlands. At the time, he was looking for a scripting language that was simple, readable, and powerful. 

 A fan of the British comedy television show 'Monty Python's Flying Circus', van Rossum chose the name Python because it was short, unique, funny, and memorable, with no relation to the snake. 

 Despite initial doubts about the name, the Python language has become a huge success, being one of the most popular languages in the world and used by millions of people in various fields. 

 Even without the snake connection, the name Python remains a fun and accessible name that contributes to the language's success.
